description: Users of the Outlook desktop client were experiencing intermittent access issues with shared calendars. This issue, identified with the advisory ID ex800425, began reported occurrences around June 17, 2024, and was recognized as affecting a broader user base than initially highlighted in the associated health alert. Specifically, users faced challenges when attempting to update or cancel calendar items, raising disruptions in productivity. The problem was officially categorized as a known issue, which was ultimately resolved and marked as 'service restored' on July 12, 2024, following a prolonged monitoring period. System administrators are advised to verify the status of shared calendar access for users, as the problem has now been mitigated effectively.
